Analysis.PauseSimulationShrinkingJFrame, CABrowser
public class ShrinkingJFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame

Creates a JFrame that shrinks when exiting.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

ShrinkingJFrame

public ShrinkingJFrame()
Creates a frame that shrinks to nothing when requested.

ShrinkingJFrame

public ShrinkingJFrame(java.lang.String title)
Creates a frame that shrinks to nothing when requested.

Parameters:
title - The title displayed on the frame.

ShrinkingJFrame

public ShrinkingJFrame(java.lang.String title,
                       java.awt.GraphicsConfiguration graphicsConfiguration)
Creates a frame that shrinks to nothing when requested.

Parameters:
title - The title displayed on the frame.
graphicsConfiguration - The graphics configuration, which may be null.
Method Detail

actionAfterShrinking

public void actionAfterShrinking()
Should be overridden by child classes to perform any desired action after the animation finishes shrinking the frame. This method will be called automatically. Examples might be pausing the CA, or saving data. The default action (when not overridden) is to do nothing.

actionBeforeShrinking

public void actionBeforeShrinking()
Should be overridden by child classes to perform any desired action prior to starting the animation that shrinks the frame. This method will be called automatically. Examples might be pausing the CA, or saving data. The default action (when not overridden) is to do nothing.

shrink

public void shrink(boolean dispose)
Shrinks the frame. After shrinking, hides the frame, but does not exit the application.

Parameters:
dispose - When true, eliminates the window. When false hides the window but does not close it. Once eliminated, attempts to redisplay the window may cause unpredictable behavior.

shrink

public void shrink(java.awt.Point finalScreenPosition,
                   boolean dispose)
Shrinks the frame and moves to the specified position as it shrinks. Designed to make it look like the frame is shrinking into a specific place. After shrinking, hides the frame, but does not exit the application.

Parameters:
finalScreenPosition - The position to which the frame moves as it shrinks. May be null.
dispose - When true, eliminates the window. When false hides the window but does not close it. Once eliminated, attempts to redisplay the window may cause unpredictable behavior.

shrinkAndExitApplication

public void shrinkAndExitApplication()
Makes the frame fade away and then exits the application.

getPercentOriginalSize

public float getPercentOriginalSize()
Get the area of the frame as a percentage of its original size.

Returns:
The percentage of it's original size.

setAnimationLength

public void setAnimationLength(int milliseconds)
Sets the length of the animation in milliseconds. Short animations are less annoying, but longer animations are smoother. The default value is 200.

Parameters:
milliseconds - Length of the animation.

setPercentOriginalSize

public void setPercentOriginalSize(float percentOriginalSize)
Set the size of the frame as a percentage of the original area.
